ygData.subject: RE: Somethin seems wrong (long response)
ygData.msgSnippet: I have to agree... not much sense in paying less for banded than it costs to buy ringmail from an NPC (when someone sells ringmail to that NPC and you buy it)
ygData.messageBody:
I have to agree...
not much sense in paying less for banded than it costs to buy ringmail from
an NPC (when someone sells ringmail to that NPC and you buy it) or chain...

After all, banded is superior to both...

the flooding of the markets is the reason I stopped playing with the
forge...

maybe i'll return someday to do scaled plate...

-----Original Message-----
From: David Rogers [mailto:derogers334@...]
Sent: Sunday, July 11, 1999 5:06 AM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Somethin seems wrong (long response)


From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>

--- kurt walther <itzkurt@...> wrote:
> But it's the greedy assholes like you who try to
make
> other people pay for your lack of skill who ruin the
> trade. Pay for your own mistakes.

I find this highly amusing. People like you who
insist on flooding the market with cheap banded are
doing a few things.

1) you're driving smiths away; it's not worth their
time anymore. But I know, you think this is good
because you get more business.

2) you 'teach' the buyers they don't have to pay more
than rock-bottom prices. But again, you think this is
good because you get more business, because you're
happy making a few gold over cost.

3) you flood the market, so everyone has banded, so
very soon, the server has all the banded it needs.

This is the one I laugh about, because you're too
shortsighted to understand it. When everyone has
banded, you log on and auction you're selling it, and
everyone shrugs because they already have what they
want.

Have fun in the pit you've dug for yourself. Or are
you going to flame me like you flamed him too?

===
:D
Dave's World
-No matter where you go, there you are-
"People will believe a lie either because they want to
believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
First Rule, Sword of Truth, Terry Goodkind
